TopicTitle: What will you do first in 1.0?

Articles.Content: Check if there are new planets. If so, I will explore. If not, I will exit the game because it won't be worth my time.
Test every feature added.
Get the spaceplanes that never worked due to asym. flame-outs out of the hangar and into space!
Launch, of course!

> 
> Learn the new aero model. Many of my rocket, spacecraft, and mission designs are based on aerodynamic simulations that I perform outside of the game. I'll have to learn how the new aero model works, modify my simulations, and develop new design guidelines.

pretty much this. I'll launch a craft and see what I have to do to make it explode on re-entry. Then I'll go just a little slower than that...

After that I will rebuild my Apollo replica and increase how stock it is.

In my mind, if you can't build an accurate looking Apollo 1-Apollo 17 in stock then the game is not ready for release. Fairings are a good step on the way to that being reality. Larger fuel tanks or procedural fuel tanks would be another step.
Find every thing they have added e.g Easter eggs
wait... until the main mods are being updated too
I'll make a rocket plane and test how realistic it will be.
Art with fairing separation.

After the innitial first look at everything new, and testing how the new aerodynamics compare to FAR and old souposphere, by seeing what my shuttle handles like, I'll have a look at the Tutorials and Scenarios, just cause I haven't looked at them since I bought the game back in 0.22, and I wanna see what they did with it. Then I'll play through career, stock, on normal settings, and then I'll see from there. 1.1 might be on the horizon by the time I get through that career. If not, a heavily modded sandbox mode to bridge the time is probably gonna happen.

> 
> Check if there are new planets. If so, I will explore. If not, I will exit the game because it won't be worth my time.

After the huge amount of work and large array of features SQUAD will have put into this update, you will disregard this due to "no planets". A teensy bit rude and disrespectful?

Mind the language, please.
Cross my fingers and hope that the new tech tree actually makes wheels available early on.

> 
> Cross my fingers and hope that the new tech tree actually makes wheels available early on.

The tech tree is still my biggest worry.
I will do what I always do - start a new vanilla Let's Play from ground zero! Can't wait! Hopefully by then I'll have some new Science / Tutorial videos done on Kepler's Laws of Planetary Motion.
Start new save... again... That and using fairings...
Start grumbling: "Back in my days the atmosphere was like soup and the fairings were made out of wing parts!" ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Update my mods...
try to make bigger aircraft.
Keep beating on the refresh button on the forums waiting for my addons to update ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Make planes and finish my space shuttle (larger than zekes so far) and finish my stock iss that is hollow and real size.

Make a Mun Base (when contracts call for it). Make a Mimnus Base (because dem hills and flats need to be explored). Make a Duna Station AND a Duna Base (and make sure Jeb, Bill, Bob, AND Val are in it). Make space planes that double (to an extent) as rockets. Mine the new resources for 1.0.
Make weird shapes with fairings.

Well, I'll probably check out my most successful spaceplane designs to see if they still fly properly. Then I'll get to work on my Super Fueler SSTO (the goal of which is to get a full Kerbodyne tank to a 125km orbit, dock with a station, and return to KSC), which will hopefully have much less lag and much more space. Once the few mods I do use are updated, I'll get working on the rockets; culminating in a career mode where I put a kerbal on all of the planets (at least), on hard mode this time!
Build new engines, including fairings as parts.

-Make a satellite of love with Jeb and Val ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
